name: directness
content:
directness noun [U]
(HONESTY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of saying what you think in a very honest way, without worrying about other people's opinions: Their work has a directness and emotional honesty that's difficult to find in contemporary art. He handled the embarrassing crisis with characteristic directness.
More examplesFewer examplesThe book treats a difficult subject with great simplicity and directness.What makes us most uncomfortable is the film's emotional directness.He addresses this big topic with a refreshing directness.

directness noun [U]
(STRAIGHTNESS)
the quality of moving in a straight line towards something or someone without stopping or changing direction: He will always trouble defenders with the speed and directness of his running. They deserved victory for a greater variety and directness in attack. See
direct
More examplesFewer examplesUK Cyclists have been directed to former walkways in order to improve the directness of their journeys.Integration with vehicular traffic would be acceptable, provided that directness of route was in no way compromised.
